Saul Toscano-Palmerin

I'm from Morelia, a colonial city located in Mexico. Currently living in Ithaca, NY.

LinkedIn Github e-Mail

I am a PhD student in the School of Operations Research and Information Engineering (ORIE) of Cornell University, where I am advised by Prof. Peter Frazier.


My research focuses on the development and analysis of Bayesian optimization algorithms, and their application for training machine learning algorithms, optimization via simulation, and design of experiments.


Previously, I did a one year internship at Uber to solve pricing and transportation problems.


Before joining Cornell, I received a B.S. degree in Mathematics by the Center for Mathematical Research (CIMAT) under the supervision of Prof. Victor Perez-Abreu.
